channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Britain Needs China’s Money. It Fears What Comes With It.
item.description: A botched spying case prompted accusations that the British government was soft on China, highlighting tensions between economic and national security...

item.title: Syria’s only female minister on what she says to her new president about hiring women: ‘quotas are so important’
item.description: "Syria is a mosaic," H.E. Hind Kabawat told Fortune, herself a member of the Christian minority and an exile from the country for some 14 years.

item.title: Skyrocketing valuations, revenues, and investments: ‘That sounds like a tech story. It’s a women’s sports story,’ Alexis Ohanian says
item.description: Women’s sports revenue is expected to hit a record-breaking $2.35 billion this year.

item.title: Virginia Democrats to Begin Redistricting Votes in Latest Battle for Congress
item.description: State lawmakers are convening to take a vote that would allow redistricting before next year’s midterms, though the process would take months.

item.title: Qualcomm CEO warns that ‘everybody’s playing to win’ when it comes to an AI bubble—but it’s still too early to tell who will succeed
item.description: Cristiano Amon says AI’s long-term potential is being underestimated, even as growing hype and soaring valuations spark comparisons to the dot-com bub...

item.title: Indiana Governor Calls Special Session to Boost Republicans in Congress
item.description: Indiana is the latest state to consider redrawing its maps at the request of the Trump administration, though it was not clear if Republicans have eno...

item.title: Wall Street’s bull run reaches a make-or-break week as Trump-Xi talks and Fed decisions loom
item.description: The S&P 500 has shot up a stunning 37% since hitting a low in April.

item.title: As New Yorkers Flood Early Voting Sites, Undecideds Become Prized Target
item.description: Zohran Mamdani, the front-runner for mayor of New York City, has built his lead in part by relying on a huge ground-game operation.

item.title: Kendra Scott says she launched her billion-dollar business from her bedroom with just $500 when she was pregnant with her first son
item.description: Scott started at the bottom, but is now one of the few women in the U.S. to have founded a billion-dollar company.

item.title: ICE Detains British Media Commentator Sami Hamdi
item.description: Sami Hamdi, who often speaks against Israel, was in the United States on a speaking tour. The Department of Homeland Security said his visa had been r...

item.title: Laurie Metcalf and Other Steppenwolf Members on 50 Years of ‘Freedom Onstage’
item.description: Laurie Metcalf, Gary Sinise and other members of the Chicago company reminisce about unexpected performances, stunning monologues and career-changing ...

item.title: Trump Administration Live Updates: President Meets With Japan’s Emperor in Tokyo
A New Dynamic in the Trump-Netanyahu Relationship
item.description: Since an Israel-Hamas cease-fire deal came into effect, the U.S. effort to sustain it appears to have constrained Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

item.title: Britain Needs China’s Money. It Fears What Comes With It.
item.description: A botched spying case prompted accusations that the British government was soft on China, highlighting tensions between economic and national security...

item.title: Going Down the Junk Food Rabbit Hole
item.description: Alice Callahan, a reporter for the Well desk, explored the history of ultraprocessed foods and how they became a major threat to our health.
